Reviews.Title: Nothing's happened, so I think it does what it's supposed to
Reviews.Author: maxmasa31 "maxmasa31"
Reviews.Content: This item is a little hard to review, in the sense that if it does what it's supposed to, nothing is supposed to happen.  But all kidding aside, I do think that having what appears to be a security camera in my garage will help keep my house more secure.  I've already been a victim of buglary and was in the market for one of these fake cameras, so I had to scoop one up when I found it on Vine and I think it'll work perfectly with my motion sensor lights.In regards to the actual item, it's a cheap, plastic dome with a flashing red light that mounts to a wall or ceiling via screws, much like a battery-operated tap light (which this essentially is).  And while it feels cheaply made, it looks great, which is what really matters with a device like this.  It's a smooth, clear, plastic dome surrounding what looks like a digital camera lens mounted on a solid plastic base.  Holding it in my hand, I'd know it's fake, but from just a few feet away, I'd honestly think it was a real, working security camera!The "camera" takes three AA batteries, which I think is a little excessive for such a low-powered blinking light, and is rated to last 2-3 months according to the instruction manual.  The light is very bright (almost TOO bright) and should be easily seen even during the day.I also like that the camera comes with four little window stickers that say, "WARNING! SECURITY SYSTEM."  It's a nice little touch to help with deterring would-be criminals.The only real problem I have with this product is that there is an empty hole where the "ON/OFF" switch should be.  I assumed that it was a leftover from the mold from a real security camera housing, but according to the instruction manual, there is supposed to be a working switch on the base of the unit.  Do I have a defective unit?  I don't hear any plastic rattling around inside and the hole is completely hollow, so it's not a recessed switch.  I want the light on, so I don't really care, and I suppose if you want it off, you can take the batteries out, so it's not a big deal.  Still, this kind of thing makes an already cheap-feeling product feel even cheaper.  Minus one star for that.Ultimately, I would have paid Amazon's asking price for this unit because I think it will do what I want it to: deter potential thieves/vandals.  And for that, four stars.

Reviews.Title: deterrent makes me feel a bit better
Reviews.Author: Shelley Gammon "Geek"
Reviews.Content: While Defender does make real security devices, they do not make a real one that looks quite like this - so I used a little nail polish remover to take the "Defender" wording off of the shell. No need in tipping off a potential thief that this is a bogus item. Let them wonder. Whether it's to keep thieves at bay - or just to make delivery folks behave - works for me. It's subtle enough to not attract attention - I don't want everyone in the neighborhood thinking I've got stuff worth steeling because they see cameras - but I do want anyone creeping around my house to be startled by it if they see it and think twice about taking the risk of getting caught.

Reviews.Title: looks like the real thing
Reviews.Author: Lynn Hoffman, author:The Short Course in Beer
Reviews.Content: this little plastic bulb looks and blinks just like a real security camera. you should know that the installation template is a bit confusing and you may have to reinstall the device. there are security stickers that come along with it, but they look so phony that they almost negate the value of the device. if i were a burglar and i saw them, i would know that no real security system was in place.

Reviews.Title: Clever
Reviews.Author: Carbonadam "Ladies and gentleman, I hope that...
Reviews.Content: This is a clever unit that will work only if it can be placed high in non essential areas. I would imagine if you have a huge security system a few dozen of these could add extra perceived security to cut down on overall costs. It uses little power and the batteries will last forever since it just blinks. Close up it will not fool anyone because it does not move and it's obvious it's just a plastic shell with no real camera in it.

Reviews.Title: Watch out Burglars!
Reviews.Author: JJ "avid reader"
Reviews.Content: This couldn't have come at a better time!  In our county in the months of September - October there were 541 home robberies!  Instead of getting an expensive security system, as many of our friends and neighbors are doing,  I am hoping that this little gem will do the job.  It looks so real.  The flashing red light gives it such an authentic look.  An added touch are the 4 window stickers saying "Warning Security System".It comes with everything necessary to install & an explanation booklet.  I am hoping this will deter felons from breaking into our home.  I know it will help.

Reviews.Title: VERY Good "Poor Mans" Security
Reviews.Author: Weatherman
Reviews.Content: The title says it all.This is not a wired security system that will record and/or call the police.  However it's the next best thing to it.Box has everything you need BUT three AAA batteries.  Also the on/off light twitch was missing on mine, but that made no difference to me as I want the LED light on.The box also has four "monitored by Defender" security stickers that you stick outward from your indoor windows. Very realistic.  Screws and a mounting diagram.There is a 24/7 toll free number with questions.  Also an email address.The most difficult part would be climbing a ladder to mount this where nobody can tamper with it.After that, the red light blinks once every few seconds.  Bright enough to get the attention of people.  And with the dome, people don't know what direction it's pointing.  Nor can one tell if it's "real" or no.I have a  friend who worked security at a local business and he stated the cameras there were "dummy" cameras, not wired or anything.  Just a wire that went up into the ceiling.  But if you're a bad guy, are you gonna take the chance of being caught on camera?? Chances are you won't.For people getting this, I advise tell NOBODY it's not real.  Install it at a time when people are not around, early in the AM, late afternoon or as dark as you feel comfortable working.  The less people you tell (even your best friends talk to others) and the less people who see you working, the better.ANYTHING that makes a "bad person" think twice about during harm to your property is enough to make them move on to something else.  And this Dome Security is just enough to make people think twice.

Reviews.Title: Cheap way of extended your security grid..
Reviews.Author: Bromptonboy "Bromptonboy"
Reviews.Content: This device is a useful addition to your already existing security system.  As long as potential trespassers are already aware that you have a security grid in place, this is a inexpensive way of 'extending' the safety net around your house.  3 AA batteries are needed, and then an ominous red LED light will show that your 'sentinel' is on (or not on) the job..  ;)

Reviews.Title: Fake Security which would probably work
Reviews.Author: Pikmin
Reviews.Content: First thing - This looks exactly like a real camera. It is very easy to get fooled by looking at this camera and thinking that there is some kinda security over the house. The dome and the flashing LED make it look very real. The installation itself is very straigtforward. It does come with screws but I could not use the screws so ended up using a 3MM dual sided tape to attach it to the porch frame. Overall, it works exactly as described and if you do not have a security camera then get this cheap imitation to ward off tresspassers.

Reviews.Title: Effective deterrent.
Reviews.Author: J. Hoelscher "debater7"
Reviews.Content: A couple of months ago, a number of homes in our neighborhood were burglarized. While we waited for the HOA to make a decision on new security measures, I ordered these "cameras." They seemed like a good temporary measure. My wife and I were impressed as soon as we opened the box. Defender makes security cameras and the PH301 looks authentic because it uses the same housing as Defender's working cameras. It installed easily (just screw in the paper guide and insert the screw heads into the slots on the camera). We've had guests over, including an electrical engineer who builds security systems, but none of them realized it was fake. Also, our HOA is now looking into installing cameras because our neighbors noticed the "upgrades." So, these cameras will fool people.However, don't get a false sense of security. Imitation cameras work best as part of a security system. We also installed new locks and an audible alarm, for example. The imitation cameras are most useful when supported by other visible measures that will lend credibility to their deterrent effect and give you another line of defense in case an intruder isn't deterred. For the price, though, they seem to pack a strong deterrent punch because of their very authentic appearance. One thing about the PH301, the flashing LED seems out of place for this type of camera. A few people remarked on that. We took the batteries out. Also, the PH300 seems more intimidating.

Reviews.Title: Bit Overwhelmimg To Install! For A Fake That Is!
Reviews.Author: Pink Breadsticks
Reviews.Content: I must say I was excited when this arrived. However, the package weighed next to nothing. The camera is so light in cheap plastic design that a piece of scotch tape might hold it to the roof. Then it included all these schematically detailed installation instructions with mounting screws and bracket etc that I just packed it right back up. Too much crap for a fake.That is until I saw my doublesided tape & velcro stickies in a drawer. WALA! I had it up in under 3 seconds! And once it's up you can't tell the difference. Looks are everything! It looks real! It operates like a real one and who can tell it's not?

Reviews.Title: I stuck this on my desk to freak out my coworkers
Reviews.Author: J. Moore "Zombie Prep Network"
Reviews.Content: I have read that the presence of security cameras is one of the biggest deterrents to burglary. The nice thing about this bad boy is that it looks incredibly real. I understand that it's made from the guts of a real security camera, so it may be hard for anybody but a skilled burglar to detect as fake.I stuck my to my desk with some velcro tape and made sure the blinking light faced outward. My coworkers kind of froze when they walked by and caught a glimpse of the dome.A couple asked, "is that thing real?".So, if security is a concern and you can't afford a real CCTV system this may be a good deterrent. No security system is foolproof, but for the price - why not try it?

Reviews.Title: Looks like the real thing
Reviews.Author: Ace
Reviews.Content: It's convincing and the red light definitely has a deterrent factor, BUT -- why is there NO On/Off switch? ther'e's a SLOT for one -- the instructions mention the On/Off swith but there is just an empty space (that says "On/Off") where it should be.THAT is very inconvenient. When I get home every night I have to take the unit OFF the wall (certainly can't mount it on the ceiling for this!) and open the back, take out one battery and the next morning before I leave -- replace the battery, close the back, and put this "camera" back on the wall.Is this an oversight -- or-- did the factory decide to cut costs????

Reviews.Title: Peace Of Mind For A Mere $10!
Reviews.Author: Tante Maren "Maren"
Reviews.Content: If you are having security issues and need actual photographs or proof of what is going on, this is not going to be of help to you. However, this Defender Imitation Dome Security Camera is so realistic that it is not only a great deterrent, but will bring you great peace of mind for only $10.00. Do these fake cameras work? ABSOLUTELY. At every place I worked, the owners used them. I worked at a Dry Cleaners who had a safe in the back. They had 2 security cameras and never had a robbery. One camera was real that didn't work and the other camera was an imitation. Both were mounted on the ceiling and you couldn't tell the two apart. Only if you held them in your hands could you see which was real and which was fake, as the real cameras are heavy. Another large cosmetic factory where I worked for years had employee problems. Working shoulder to shoulder on production lines all day caused tempers to flair on occasion, and sometimes someone would get their car egged or keyed, so to stop this problem, the company installed security cameras all around the parking lot. Needless to say, we never knew if the cameras were real or fake, but the car keying and egging magically stopped!This Defender Imitation Dome Security Camera looks exactly like the real thing. You could put this side by side with a real one and you would not know which was which on the ceiling. Only close up and in your hand will you feel the heavier real camera. This imitation camera comes with mounting equipment, as it is designed to be mounted on a ceiling and look down. I found it easier to install with string through the battery door and the string taped with heavy packing tape to an inside window frame, rather than drilling holes and screwing it in permanently, for a perfect view of our yard. This imitation camera is super light and can easily be held in place with simple string and tape. The battery compartment holds 3 AA batteries, which are supposed to last 3 months. Also, there is a one year guarantee, which means you can have a great LED flashing deterrent for only $10.00 a year and of course forever if you just use the dome without the flashing LED, should the LED finally fail.Another great thing is this camera can be mounted inside or outdoors. Since the unit is all plastic, it will stay perfect outside no matter what the weather. The flashing red LED light is wonderful- just like the real ones- it says the tape is filming you right now. Also included are 4 window warning stickers- just like the real ones come with, which is a nice touch for added security. Even if you need a real camera, you can also use these fakes for more security in combination with the real ones. No one ever knew at the Dry Cleaners where I worked for years that there was one real camera and one fake one side by side. It's just more added deterrents to help safeguard your property. If you want 24/7 protection- all cameras whether real or fake will always do the job, as after all, what crook is willing to take that chance of being photographed and this $10.00 Defender Imitation Dome will do just that!

Reviews.Title: No break-ins or graphitti on the truck--must be working?
Reviews.Author: QueenKatieMae
Reviews.Content: We were getting tired of neighborhood taggers leaving their mark on the side of my husband's huge white truck. This imitation security cam looks exactly like the ones you see in hospitals and banks. Just aim the blinking red light toward the front and it looks like the real deal. Now, it is hard to gauge whether the camera or the cold weather is preventing the thugs from visiting the truck late at night. Coincidence? Don't know, don't care. No one has touched the truck and that was the goal. Let you know of any future events.

Reviews.Title: A good and ECONOMICAL -- answer.
Reviews.Author: majormusiclover
Reviews.Content: This Security device is a great way to gain some peace of mind at an inexpensive price.True, it's not really connected to a camera or a responce teem,but it does look realistic enough that you're likely the only one that will know.This imitation dome camera is based on, and looks identical to an actual camera.When it is strategicly positioned it will definitely get visitors to thinkyou have some sort of surveillance system.The continually flashing red LED light is at 2 second intervals.The dome comes with an install guide card for easy installation and 2 screws.It requires 3 AA batteries that AREN'T included and are expected to last 2-3 months.Four window and/or door 'WARNING' stickers are included.Directly above the LED light is the 'Defender' logo.When the light is pointed the direction you need it to be,you can't avoid seeing the logo.If one is concerned that potential criminals will recognize the 'Defender' logo is a fakethere are ways to cover that over. (gloss black paint, tape, etc)We chose to cut one of the 4 window stickers in strips so the lines of'WARNING!' and 'SECURITY CAMERA' could be used separately.Like-wise the 'Defender' logo can be cut away from the stickersso they say only 'Warning' - 'Security Camera' when used on windows and doors.Our neighborhood has recently had some teenagers attempting break-ins.This economical dome, along with the window stickers will help keep them guessing.

Reviews.Title: Does what it supposed to do, and can be mounted several ways
Reviews.Author: J. Robson "Reflective Artist & Product Designer"
Reviews.Content: I like this unit. It basically looks like our "real ones"! We have these  mixed in with the real cameras. That's how nice they look! These can be mounted on a wall also and it still looks and works great.If you *only* have this, yeah it looks nice, and so far stands up to the rain. If you DO have a camera system.. get some of these and they will blend in with your camera setup and only you will know which ones are real!

Reviews.Title: Lightweight, convincing appearance, modest price.
Reviews.Author: Valnastar "Man With No Name"
Reviews.Content: This fake security camera is certainly cheaper than a real one yet looks convincing enough to hopefully discourage bad behavior, vandalism, etc. where desired. It does eat batteries a bit as it takes three AA batteries, but they should last a while since the power demands of the device are slight. You can also use this item in conjunction with a real camera to make your security system seem larger than it is or to make it more difficult to discern where real devices are placed.

Reviews.Title: Would Fool Me
Reviews.Author: Tyson
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking, I wouldn't say criminals are the world's smartest bunch. So, if a simple camera (real or fake) would deter them, I have all the confidence in the world that this little forgery from "Defender" would scare them off--or at least inspire them to put on a creative mask. The product itself is made of sturdy material and looks extremely authentic. And then the cute little LED light seals the deal. In my opinion, the only possible way someone could spot this as a fake is if they are an Amazon.com shopper and familiar with the "DEFENDER" logo.Some places I think this would work perfectly:- Front porch- Classrooms- Restaurant/Stores- Apartment complexesOr.. anywhere, really. The design is of the typical commercial camera one might expect to see in a Wal-mart or other type of business, but sticking it above your front porch wouldn't be unbelievable by a long shot. If you own a business I would still suggest investing in a real camera system (for the obvious benefits) but if the budget is tight, this is the next best thing. Wholly authentic and nicely made, though only time will tell just how effective it is, I suppose. Should I get burglarized, I will certainly update my review.

Reviews.Title: And if a thief sees this product...?
Reviews.Author: Kort "Art, Music, Book & Movie Enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: This imitation security camera is a great deterrent, ...as long as the thief hasn't seen it here on Amazon. If they get close enough to read the "DEFENDER" logo, then the gig is up.Tip: install with the logo turned to the least visible angle.Not everyone can afford an expensive security camera system. For the price, this mock-camera at least gives the appearance that the property is monitored. The blinking LED is a nice touch and it is designed like the real thing. It's no substitute for a working security system however. If you are able to, at least use it in conjunction with a home alarm system. Seen with a Brinks or ADT sign in the yard, it might keep a casual opportunistic thief from looking closer. Just keep in mind that anyone that has seen it here on Amazon (like you have), or in a store, will know that it is a fake.Defender does make functioning security cameras, but I'm not aware of any models that look exactly like this one.~ Kort

Reviews.Title: Looks like the real thing; work's like it too
Reviews.Author: Laurence R. Bachmann "LRB"
Reviews.Content: Like others reviewing the product, you guess it's effective because you aren't burglarized.  I do think the flashing LED light is a nice touch.  And I love the idea of scamming a felon.

Reviews.Title: Unsatisfactory
Reviews.Author: michael a. draper
Reviews.Content: Every home could use more security but costs can be prohibitive.This device would give the idea that your home or office has a professional security camera recording people at your doorway.The packaging informs us the camera is discrete, about the size of a half grapefruit, and easy to mount.It also states on the package that there is a flashing LED  to deter crime.My neighborhood has many homeowners who have boats that they store by their garage in the winter. This dark place is unsecure and could be tempting to someone wanting to see if the boat has any valuable items. Since it is battery operated, the device could be mounted on the side of the garage, again giving the impression that the area is being recorded.I rate this a three star for potential but not for effect.There are also foun window "Warning" stickers indicating a security system is in operation.However, there is supposed to be an on/off switch included which would turn the LED on or off. This was omitted from my sample, so unless I wanted to leave this on permanently or remove the device from where it is placed, it would have to remain on. With this in mind, I didn't install it.

Reviews.Title: Who You Foolin?
Reviews.Author: A. L. W. "sweetbaker"
Reviews.Content: This item is better than nothing. However, anyone able to get close enough to see the word"defender" will be tipped off immediately. Perhaps, blacking out the words with a black marker would be better. When you go into stores typically you don't see a"brand name" on the security product or a flashing light because they want the item to go unnoticed in most cases. Perhaps the second drawback is the hassle to replace the batteries. Once you mount it up, it's a nuisance to get it down. Certainly better than nothing, but don't expect to fool everyone.

Reviews.Title: Looks realistic, but batteries drain fast
Reviews.Author: LLM
Reviews.Content: Dummy camera looks realistic, is relatively easy to install, but batteries drain after fairly short use.  The unit takes 3 AA batteries to operate the flashing red LED.  Used new Energizer Lithium batteries, but LED no longer lit after about 2 or so weeks of use.

Reviews.Title: security Cam
Reviews.Author: William D. Manassau "danno"
Reviews.Content: Looks ok.  Uses 3 batterys.  They will be inconvenient to change due to location.  I thought it would come with a way to run electic to it.  It may work with the amateur thiefs.

Reviews.Title: Fine item.
Reviews.Author: Emer Foley "Emer Foley"
Reviews.Content: Anything helps when you're trying to deter crooks. I have read that a "beware of dog" sign works the best. If a crook sees that then they stay away. And a Dome flashing light works the same way. It doesn't really have to be hooked to anything. If a crook seess this they are going to stay away. perfect to put in a garage. Worth the small investment.

Reviews.Title: Great Looking Dummy Camera
Reviews.Author: Kaya Savas
Reviews.Content: I guess if your budget is low and you need a good looking dummy camera then this isn't a bad route. Although most crooks get caught on camera anyway so I don't even know if they'd be looking for this. Anyway, if you need a prop it makes for a good one too. The lens looks pretty real up close. The only think is that my review product came with a broken switch so I was not able to test the flashing LED. It's lightweight and comes with two mounting screws for you to attach to the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Tim E Robertson "Publisher MyMac"
Reviews.Content: So this is NOT real, but MAN it looks real! We actually have a bunch of cameras in our store, so I put this one right where people could see it when they walk in our are walking by. I see people look at it all the time, and none think it is fake! It's crazy and cool!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: sunluvin
Reviews.Content: The on/off switch was missing and the package had clearly been opened before it was shipped to me. I think the made in china indicates the quality. I miss seeing made in america on products.

Reviews.Title: Significantly inaccurate product descriptions by manufacturer
Reviews.Author: Grits
Reviews.Content: The product description on line says it is easy to mount with an adjustable mounting bracket.  But there was no such bracket in the package, and the instruction booklet included with the device mentions no such adjustable bracket.The product description in the booklet mentions the on/off switch for the LED with instructions on how to turn it on and off.  There is a hole where the switch SHOULD be, but no switch (and nothing rattling inside to suggest it somehow just broke and stayed inside the unit).Also, the stated battery life of just 2-3 months seems poor.  Rechargeable batteries will last even less than that, so heavy duty batteries will have to be used.  The unit will have to be unmounted from the wall or ceiling frequently to replace the three AA batteries - inconvenient, and probably more expense than necessary, or economically reasonable after many battery replacements.  In just one year, owners will spend as much or more for batteries as they will for the unit itself.I love the concept, and the flashing red LED light is quite visible, particularly in the dark - but it cannot be turned off unless the unit is both removed from the mounting and the batteries removed.  If the company wants a better review, then they need to provide an accurate product description and not over-sell products based on non-existent features.

ProductInfo.Features:
Provides realistic security camera effect to deter crime
Flashing red LED to deceive intruders
Quick and simple installation
Expand your home and business security system at low cost
24/7 Lifetime Live Customer Support
ProductInfo.Name: Defender PH301 Imitation Dome Security Camera with Realistic Flashing Red LED
